Package datastructure

Class VariablePositionsTable

java.lang.Object
datastructure.VariablePositionsTable
public final class VariablePositionsTable
extends java.lang.Object
Major data structure to store the results of Musial.

Implements a variety of thread safe data structures to store the information parsed from `.vcf` files. In addition accessor methods to retrieve the stored data either as statistics or in a String format for the generation of human readable output are implemented.

Since:
2.0
Version:
2.0
Author:
Simon Hackl

  • Field Details

    • table

      private final java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.lang.String,​java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.lang.String,​java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentSkipListMap<java.lang.String,​VariablePosition>>> table
      Thread safe table structure that stores all information parsed from `.vcf` files in the form of VariablePosition instances.

      The first key represents the analyzed reference feature, e.g. in the case of a full genome analysis the internal name of the genome or in the case of single genes the gene names.

      The second key represents the name of the analyzed sample.

      The third key represents the position on the reference as a String. In the most cases this will simply be the String representation of the Integer position, however, to represent an insertion in any sample the character `I` is appended: I.e. if an insertion at position 10 of length 2 was analyzed, the keys 10I and 10II will be used. The third key set is sorted by the VariablePositionTableComparator. This system allows for an easy insertion of `-` gap symbols in those samples in which no insertion occurred.

    • variantPositions

      private final java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.lang.String,​java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentSkipListSet<java.lang.String>> variantPositions
      Thread safe structure mapping reference locations to a list of positions at which a variant was called.

    • insertionPositions

      private final java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.lang.String,​java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentSkipListSet<java.lang.String>> insertionPositions
      Thread safe structure mapping reference locations to a list of positions at which an insertion is present.

  • Method Details

    • putVariablePosition

      public void putVariablePosition​(java.lang.String referenceAnalysisId, java.lang.String sampleName, java.lang.String genomePosition, VariablePosition variablePosition, int alleleIndex)
      Inserts a new VariablePosition instance into the table structure.
      Parameters:
      referenceAnalysisId - String the name of the reference feature to access.
      genomePosition - String representing the analyzed reference feature.
      sampleName - String representing the name of the sample.
      variablePosition - VariablePosition to insert.
      alleleIndex - Integer representing the index of a possible alternate allele.

    • putSampleInReference

      public void putSampleInReference​(java.lang.String referenceAnalysisId, java.lang.String sampleName)
      Inserts empty ConcurrentHashMap and ConcurrentSkipListMap structures into the table if none are present for a specified reference analysis entry and sample name.

      This method is intended to be used for samples with only confident reference calls are these will not be considered for the output files otherwise.

      Parameters:
      referenceAnalysisId - String the name of the reference feature to access.
      sampleName - String representing the name of the sample.

    • getVariablePosition

      public VariablePosition getVariablePosition​(java.lang.String referenceAnalysisId, java.lang.String sampleName, java.lang.String position)
      Returns a VariablePosition stored in the table.

      May return null of no entry exists.

      Parameters:
      referenceAnalysisId - String representing the reference analysis identifier / feature identifier to access.
      sampleName - String representing the sample identifier to access.
      position - String representing the position to access.
      Returns:
      VariablePosition from the table.

    • getFeatureIdentifiers

      public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getFeatureIdentifiers()
      Returns all stored feature location names as list.
      Returns:
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> containing all feature location names.

    • getSampleNamesOf

      public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getSampleNamesOf​(java.lang.String referenceAnalysisId)
      Returns all stored sample names for one reference location name.
      Parameters:
      referenceAnalysisId - String the name of the reference location.
      Returns:
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> containing all sample names of the specified reference location.

    • getSampleVariantsSequence

      public java.lang.String getSampleVariantsSequence​(java.lang.String referenceAnalysisId, java.lang.String sampleName, boolean fastaFormat)
      Returns the concatenation of all variant position contents for one sample.

      The contents are appended in ascending order with respect to the position value. Currently, if multiple alleles for one position are present, the one with the highest frequency is used.

      Parameters:
      referenceAnalysisId - String the name of the reference location.
      sampleName - String the name of the sample.
      fastaFormat - Boolean whether the sequence should be returned in Fasta format.
      Returns:
      String representing the concatenation of all variant position contents.

    • getSampleFullSequence

      public java.lang.String getSampleFullSequence​(java.lang.String referenceAnalysisId, java.lang.String sampleName, boolean fastaFormat)
      Returns the concatenation of all position contents for one sample.

      The contents are appended in ascending order with respect to the position value. Currently, if multiple alleles for one position are present, the one with the highest frequency is used.

      Parameters:
      referenceAnalysisId - String the name of the reference location.
      sampleName - String the name of the sample.
      fastaFormat - Boolean whether the sequence should be returned in Fasta format.
      Returns:
      String representing the concatenation of all position contents.

    • getPositionContentTabDelimited

      public java.lang.String getPositionContentTabDelimited​(java.lang.String referenceAnalysisId, java.lang.String position, int shift)
      Returns the concatenation of all sample contents for one position in tab delimited format of one reference feature location.

      The contents are appended in the order given by the sample names.

      Parameters:
      referenceAnalysisId - String the name of the reference location.
      position - String the position to access.
      shift - Integer representing a position shift, i.e. the sum of all insertions that occurred up to and including the passed position.
      Returns:
      String representing the concatenation of all sample contents on the specified position.

    • getPositionAnnotationTabDelimited

      public java.lang.String getPositionAnnotationTabDelimited​(java.lang.String referenceAnalysisId, java.lang.String position, int shift)
      Returns the concatenation of all sample annotations for one position in tab delimited format of one reference feature location.

      The annotations are appended in the order given by the sample names.

      Parameters:
      referenceAnalysisId - String the name of the reference location.
      position - String the position to access.
      shift - Integer representing a position shift, i.e. the sum of all insertions that occurred up to and including the passed position.
      Returns:
      String representing the concatenation of all sample annotations on the specified position.

    • getPositionStatisticsTabDelimited

      public java.lang.String getPositionStatisticsTabDelimited​(java.lang.String referenceAnalysisId, java.lang.String position, int shift)
      Computes and returns the number of each possible contents at one position for all samples of one reference feature location.
      Parameters:
      referenceAnalysisId - String the name of the reference location.
      position - String the position to access.
      shift - Integer representing a position shift, i.e. the sum of all insertions that occurred up to and including the passed position.
      Returns:
      String representing the counts of each possible content at the specified position.

      Parameters:
      referenceAnalysisId - String the name of the reference location.
      sampleName - String the sample to access.
      Returns:
      String representing the counts of each possible content at the specified position.

    • getSampleNamesHeaderTabDelimited

      public java.lang.String getSampleNamesHeaderTabDelimited​(java.lang.String referenceAnalysisId)
      Returns a header line for tab delimited output in which columns are sample names and each row starts with a position.

      If addReference is set to true, the second field will be "Reference".

      The output string will have the format: Position\tReference(optional)\tSAMPLE1_NAME\tSAMPLE2_NAME\t...

      Parameters:
      referenceAnalysisId - String the name of the reference location.
      Returns:
      String representing a tab delimited header line for output files.
